moves.1... e5: I guess he prefers KP openings
moves.2. d3: I don't know why I didn't play Nc3..
moves.2... h6: I thought this was premature.. my knight's not even on f3 yet
moves.3. Nc3: now I make the knight move (I think I feared pawn advance on the 2nd move, followed by f5 because, at the time, his rating was much higher than mine)
moves.4... Nf6: he's ready to castle and I'm not even close!
moves.5. a3: I try to run off the bishop
moves.5... Bc5: It worked! (usually they trade me, knight for bishop)
moves.6. e3: I don't want him to force me to move the King with Bxe2
moves.6... O-O: his king is safe.. I'm still at least 2 moves away!
moves.7. g3: I'll put my white bishop on the long diagonal
moves.7... Nc6: I would have played d6 first (but what do I know?)
moves.8. Bg2: one more piece to move and I can castle
moves.9. b4: I decide to move the bishop back some
moves.10. Bxe3: a pawn for a bishop. I don't understand, but I'll take it.
moves.11. Nf3: a bad move... I don't know what I was thinking
moves.11... d4: a pawn fork. He'll get his piece back now.
moves.12. Bxd4: trading down looked like my best option.
moves.13. Ne2: I run away.. (Nxd4, QxN didn't look good to me!)
moves.13... Re8: he prepares a nasty attack on my uncastled King
moves.14... Rb8: I guess he worried about me uncovering the white bishop
moves.15. Nexd4: now I can nab the pawn safely
moves.15... b6: looks like his bishop wants the long diagonal too
moves.17. Qc2: so, I back off, but still own the diagonal
moves.17... Nf5: he uncovers the rook and gains control of the open file
moves.18. Nxf5: I'll trade knights (they can be unpredictably dangerous)
moves.19. Rad1: the pawns position was weakened by the trade, so I add support
moves.19... Qd7: is he going to attack the bishop with Bh3, or put a rook on the file behind his Queen?
moves.20. Qc3: I didn't like the Queen behind the pawn with a bishop lined up on them, and maybe, if I'm patient, I can set up a knight fork
moves.20... Rbd8: now there are two lines of attack set up, the d-file and the c8-h3 diagonal
moves.21. Ne5: this attacks his Queen, adds protection for my d3 pawn, and opens my bishop up on the diagonal.
moves.21... Qd4: he offers to trade Queens (basically, he forces me to, or I lose the knight)
moves.22... Rxd4: so does he, and now my knight is naked again!
moves.23. Nc6: I escape, forking a pawn and rook
moves.24... Bxd3: no time to nab the pawn, I need to move the rook
moves.25. Rc1: I protect my pawn, but wonder if Rd1 would have been better
moves.26. Bf3: I try to keep the knight contained
moves.26... g5: I think he's out to free the knight with g4 to follow
moves.28. Kg2: I try to run away (like "a little girly-man")
